TITLE: Sports teams are investing $10 billion in stadiums by 2030 — here's how they'll be different
SUMMARY: The Buffalo Bills are among the NFL clubs seeking a new stadium as more pro sports teams seek venue upgrades to solicit more revenue.

TITLE: With more than half a million Americans unhoused, the U.S. is still struggling to solve the homelessness crisis
SUMMARY: The Covid pandemic caused a surge in housing costs and a rise in unemployment, leaving nearly 600,000 Americans unhoused in 2020.

TITLE: Most expensive home in America lists for $295 million, may head to auction
SUMMARY: Along with a record-setting price, the property known as "The One," in the Bel Air section of Los Angeles, comes with a history of drama, lawsuits and debt.

TITLE: China's real estate problems are spreading even to once-healthy developers
SUMMARY: Shimao Group shares briefly plunged more than 17% Friday after Reuters reported the property developer failed to make full repayment on a trust loan.

TITLE: Should you rent or buy a home? Prices are surging in both cases, which makes it complicated
SUMMARY: Home prices are rising faster than rents, which is shrinking the affordability gap between being a homeowner and a tenant.

TITLE: Several states have run out of federal rental assistance
SUMMARY: A deluge of applications has forced some states to shut their federal rental assistance programs earlier than expected.

TITLE: Still struggling financially? Here's what pandemic aid remains available to families
SUMMARY: Even as the coronavirus continues to upend American life, most pandemic-era relief measures have dried up by now. Here's what help is still available.

TITLE: Mortgage rates hit 9-month high, and loan demand drops further
SUMMARY: Mortgage rates moved significantly higher over the holidays, and that caused mortgage demand to drop.

TITLE: As China ramps up environmental efforts, property developers face more scrutiny, says fund manager
SUMMARY: China's property developers could come under greater scrutiny for flouting environmental laws, as Beijing steps up efforts to reinforce rules, says one fund manager.

TITLE: Homebuilder stocks rebound day after rate scare plunge
SUMMARY: The iShares US Home Construction ETF lost 2.69% on Monday, its worst day since September 30th when it fell 2.89%.

TITLE: Manhattan real estate breaks record in 2021, reaching $30 billion in sales
SUMMARY: "Clearly, the pace of the recovery in 2021 was faster than I think most people anticipated," said Jonathan Miller, CEO of Miller Samuel. "It's been startling."

TITLE: China Evergrande shares reopen higher; developer says contracted sales dropped 38.7% in 2021
SUMMARY: Indebted property developer China Evergrande's contracted sales plunged last year as the real estate giant struggled to repay creditors.

TITLE: Roofing giant takes on Tesla to make solar roof shingles more affordable
SUMMARY: GAF, one of the largest roofing companies in the world, just released a new solar shingle, which it says will be affordable and easy to install.

TITLE: Morgan Stanley lists 4 reasons why China's growth could be better than expected in 2022
SUMMARY: China's economy appears to be bouncing from a "mini-downturn" into an upswing as the country eases policy, according to investment bank Morgan Stanley.

TITLE: Pro-Trump lawyer says his plantations were go-to spots for those aiming to overturn the 2020 election
SUMMARY: Trump ally Lin Wood told CNBC that his plantations in South Carolina were used as a hub for those who wanted to overturn the 2020 election.

TITLE: What will the 2022 housing market look like? It could 'come back down to sanity'
SUMMARY: Housing experts say buyers can expect similar market trends to the past two years: elevated prices, low inventory and fast turnaround.

TITLE: A rapid delivery 'arms race' is driving up commercial property rents in London
SUMMARY: Estate agents say they've seen commercial rents climb in prime London locations thanks to an influx of demand from rapid grocery delivery firms.

TITLE: UBS says Chinese stock valuations are 'very attractive,' but don't expect a quick rebound
SUMMARY: The Chinese markets have underperformed by about 40% relative to peers in the U.S. and Europe, says UBS Global Wealth Management's Kelvin Tay.

TITLE: Fitch says a third of rated Chinese developers would face cash crunch in a scenario where sales fall by 30%
SUMMARY: China's real estate sector has been hit by a debt crisis as Evergrande's cash crunch came to a head. Residential sales plunged alongside home buyer confidence.

TITLE: Sales of newly built homes tank as affordability hits buyers
SUMMARY: New home sales came in much lower than expected, but prices continued to rise.

TITLE: Store closures slowed after a pandemic shakeout. Now Dollar General, Warby Parker and others see new value in stores
SUMMARY: In 2021, store openings may top store closures for the first time in five years, according to a tracking by Coresight Research.

TITLE: November home sales rose due to hot job market and concerns over rising rates next year
SUMMARY: Sales of previously owned homes in November rose 1.9% from October to 6.46 million units, according to the National Association of Realtors' seasonally adjusted count.

TITLE: CES still on, Davos postponed: Conventions industry rebound in doubt amid omicron
SUMMARY: The $100 billion conferences and events industry in the U.S. is on edge amid the recent Covid surge.

TITLE: Mortgage rates fall to a four-week low, but homebuyers still pull back due to record low listings
SUMMARY: Mortgage rates fell to a four-week low, but the tight supply of homes for sale, as well as high prices, caused a drop in loan demand from homebuyers.

TITLE: China's property developers have more than just big bond payments coming up
SUMMARY: China's struggling real estate developers face a growing number of repayment deadlines in the next few months.

TITLE: Rents for single-family homes are rising three times as fast as they were a year ago
SUMMARY: Strong demand for single-family rental homes has caused rents to rise three times faster in 2021 than they did a year earlier.

TITLE: Home flipping is getting more competitive – and less profitable
SUMMARY: The number of home flips is rising, but the profits are shrinking due to several headwinds in the housing market.

TITLE: In the market for a new home? Here’s what to do now to set yourself up for success in the new year
SUMMARY: The hot housing market is expected to continue in 2022, although it won't be as frenzied, experts predict.

TITLE: Many Americans feel less financial stress thanks to pandemic-era government programs. Yet there are still signs of strain
SUMMARY: A government report shows that while many Americans had more cash to work with thanks to stimulus efforts, debts are still a struggle for many.

TITLE: Sears plans to sell or redevelop its massive corporate-office park in the Chicago suburbs
SUMMARY: Sears is considering a sale or a redevelopment of its massive corporate headquarters in suburban Chicago, as its retail footprint keeps dwindling.
